授業概要・カリキュラム上の位置づけ: This course builds on Craig Sisman’ s first semester moving image course: it is designed to help Art students become even more creative when using English. The teacher,Craig Sisman,is a native speaker of British English with a background in language education and moving image production. Craig will help students work in groups to produce their own moving image projects. During the course,students will explore(through practical experimentation)the following twelve elements of cinematic art:（1） time; （2） light; （3） form; （4） image; （6） space; （7） movement; （8） language （written and spoken）; （9） performance; （10） narrative; （11） sound; （12） music. Students will explore each element from various points-of-view,including naturalism,formalism and abstraction.
授業方法: リアルタイム型Zoomを毎回使います。学生側のカメラやマイクも必要です。グループでの作業が中心となります。
到達目標: By the end of this course students will be able to use English creatively in the production of an English language movie project.

There will be extensive group work.4．Make sure you have downloaded the Zoom app to your PC, tablet or smartphone and try using it before our classes begin. The more familiar you are with Zoom, the easier and more enjoyable your classes will be. If possible, using a PC in a private room with a good wifi connection is recommended.
準備学習内容・時間の目安: In addition to completing homework,students should prepare to be active and take advantage of the learning opportunities available（30 minutes).
成績評価の方法: Students’ grades will be based on: （1） attendance; （2） attitude to learning; （3） general participation in class; （4） individual contribution to group work; （5） class work; （6） each group’ s final movie project. The final projects will be assessed on: （a） creative use of the English language, (b) creative use of cinematic language.
教員との連絡方法（オフィスアワー）: Students may speak to the instructor before and after class as well as during class.
